title: Pop star Zac Hanson suffers broken collarbone and ribs in horror motorcycle crash in Tulsa
text:
Zac Hanson of the pop music band Hanson is recovering following a motorcycle crash in Oklahoma this week.

The 33-year-old said in posts on Twitter, Facebook and the band's website that he is recovering after suffering a broken collarbone, three broken ribs and a cracked scapula.

Hanson said he was able to walk away from the Tulsa crash thanks to 'good quality protective gear' and the help from firefighters.

Hanson posted a photo in the emergency room, where his vitals were monitored.

Zac Hanson gets checked out in the hospital after a tumble on his motorcycle left the singer with five broken bones

Zac Hanson's motorcycle that likely the vehicle involved in an accident injuring the 1990s pop star

Hanson (left to right): Zac, Taylor and Issac in Las Vegas in 2013. They had the mega-hit with 'MMMBop' in 1997. They will tour despite Zac's motorcycle crash Wednesday

Vintage Hanson, as they perform in 1997. Zac, the youngest of the pop group, left, suffered a few fractures in a motorcycle accident this week

Taylor Hanson took to Instagram wishing his brother a speedy recovery from a motorcycle crash

Details of Wednesday's crash were not revealed, but Hanson said he was preparing for a cross-country ride.

But he insisted that the show will go on for their upcoming tour.

He will not handle drumming for a few weeks as he recovers, but he will sing.

Hanson is the youngest of three brothers who formed the band in the early 1990s.

The band is best-known for their mega hit 'MMMBop,' which reached number one in 27 countries and earned them three Grammy nominations.

'Nothing is injured that won't heal with a little rest and time, and a healthy dose of gaming!' Hanson posted.
description: Zac Hanson, youngest of the Hanson brothers pop group, was injured in a Tulsa motorcycle crash. He suffered five broken bones. Their upcoming tour will go on with a different drummer.
